info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 14 at 6:23PM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT STOREY AND SOUTHERN WASHOE COUNTIES THROUGH 700 PM PDT... At 622 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms over Damonte Ranch, or 7 miles southeast of Reno, moving northwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and frequent cloud-to-ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Reno, Sparks, Lockwood, Wingfield Springs, Northwest Reno, Spanish Springs, Mogul, Golden Valley, Verdi-Mogul, Caughlin Ranch, Galena, Hidden Valley, Somersett, Washoe City, Verdi, Damonte Ranch, Pleasant Valley, Lemmon Valley, Reno-Tahoe International Airport, and Lemmon Valley-Golden Valley. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
